comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Sir Edward Hopkinson Holden, 1st Baronet (11 May 1848 – 23 July 1919) was a British banker and Liberal politician, most notable for his role in developing the Midland Bank into the largest bank in the world." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sir_Edward_Holden,_1st_Baronet "Rufus Daniel Isaacs, 1st Marquess of Reading, (10 October 1860 – 30 December 1935), was an English lawyer, jurist and politician." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rufus_Isaacs,_1st_Marquess_of_Reading They were part of a Anglo-French commission sent to New York in 1915 to help stabilise exchange rates, and help raise an Anglo-French loan of £100 million from the United States government for the conduct of the First World War. see the New-York tribune, September 11, 1915, Page 3 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1915-09-11/ed-...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Another (very different) portrait of Lord Reading.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: B-59 and swanq:  Thanks!  We'll include your additional information for Holden and Reading next time we update.
